channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 14 inch pothole, 2-3 inches deep in path of bikes, 16th November
item.description:
The pothole is massive and causes cyclists to have to swerve into the flow of traffic. Incredibly dangerous. It's been getting bigger quickly this week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Libertus Court, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is blocked whenever it rains, 16th November
item.description:
By number 88 - likely due to the gulley connection under the road to the one opposite being blocked?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Still not completed repair your ref 11418200, 16th November
item.description:
Your reference 11418200 In May 2023 I reported THREE manhole covers on Belle Vue Road Cinderford GL14 ( in road outside Cinderford library) which were rattling - one of them VERY loudly. After many telephone calls this week just one of them has been fixed but, NOT VERY NOISY ONE. So, the nuisance problem continues and I am awoken in the early hours when the traffic races up the road. Please could someone look at this outstanding problem ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: About 7" across 1-2 inch deep, 16th November

item.title: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface problem, 16th November
item.description:
email rcvd 116.11.23 - We've noticed that something has broken the concrete edging that surrounds the blocks in the entrance to our road. The edging is broken and is sticking up in the middle of the road and making noise when cars are driving over this. I have attached a picture and hope that it can be fixed quickly as may damage someoneâ€™s car or a cyclist or pedestrian Could trip on it. Our road is The Oaks,Up Hatherley. Cheltenham GL51 3TS and the damage is at the entrance to the road.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 16th November
item.description:
Customer reported water pooling around drains, not draining since works completed on the road. Concerned that once we get freezing temperatures, this will be an ice hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Cleevelands Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain is completely clogged up and causing huge flooding across the whole road, 16th November
item.description:
Drain is at the corner of Lansdown Parade and Lansdown road opposite Lansdown Pub. After rainfall the entire road floods making it difficult for pedestrians. The rainwater has nowhere to go as the drain is completely blocked. I removed surface leaves but the silt below the cover comes to the surface and does not allow water to waste away.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andover Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 16th November
item.description:
Customer reporting that during recent resurfacing works, road debris has fallen down the gullies along the road. No drainage issues currently, but customer asking that these be kept an eye on/put on the gully pot cleaning schedule to avoid any future issues.

item.title: Fallen down tree on path, 15th November
